an4.107:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of mice.
an4.107:1.3: One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it,
an4.107:1.4: one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it,
an4.107:1.5: one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and
an4.107:1.6: one both makes a hole and lives in it.
an4.107:1.7: These are the four kinds of mice.
an4.107:1.8: In the same way, these four people similar to mice are found in the world.
an4.107:1.10: One makes a hole but doesn’t live in it,
an4.107:1.11: one lives in a hole but doesn’t make it,
an4.107:1.12: one neither makes a hole nor lives in it, and
an4.107:1.13: one both makes a hole and lives in it.
an4.107:2.1: And how does a person make a hole but not live in it?
an4.107:2.2: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching—
an4.107:2.3: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
an4.107:2.4: But they don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.107:2.5: That’s how a person makes a hole but doesn’t live in it.
an4.107:2.6: That person is like a mouse that makes a hole but doesn’t live in it, I say.
an4.107:3.1: And how does a person live in a hole but not make it?
an4.107:3.2: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.107:3.4: But they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.107:4.1: And how does a person neither make a hole nor live in it?
an4.107:4.2: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.107:4.4: Nor do they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.107:5.1: And how does a person both make a hole and live in it?
an4.107:5.2: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching …
an4.107:5.4: And they really understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.107:5.8: These four people similar to mice are found in the world.”
